intro: Matelea delascioi, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Matelea delascioi thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments.
